H0.text: Electromagnetic waves are the type of waves that travel at the speed of light, as proved by Hertz.

H1.text: Sound is the type of waves that Hertz proved travel at the speed of light.

H2.text: Seismic waves are the type of waves that travel at the speed of light, as proved by Hertz.

H3.text: Tsunamis are the type of waves that Hertz proved travel at the speed of light.

A4.text: Maxwell's equations were confirmed by Heinrich Hertz through experiments with radio waves.

A5.text: Radio waves were first produced deliberately by Heinrich Hertz in 1887, using electrical circuits calculated to produce oscillations at a much lower frequency than that of visible light, following recipes for producing oscillating charges and currents suggested by Maxwell's equations.
